DOC.brief_summary: Registry is designed to evaluate use of endolumenal tissue anchors for soft tissue approximation to repair a dilated gastric pouch and gastrojejunal anastomosis in post-Roux-En-Y gastric bypass patients presenting with weight regain. Registry will also assess tissue anchor durability.
DOC.brief_title: Endolumenal Gastric Pouch and Gastrojejunal Anastomosis Reduction
DOC.criteria: 1. Patient is > 18 years of age and < 65 years of age 2. Patient is > 2 yrs postRouxenY bypass surgery 3. Patient initially achieved > 50% EWL after RouxenY bypass surgery 4. Patient is a reasonable risk to undergo general anesthesia 5. Patient is able to provide written informed consent 1. Patient has an esophageal stricture or other anatomy/condition that would preclude the use and passage of the endolumenal instruments 2. Physician determines another causal factor for weight regain other than stoma or pouch dilation 3. Patient is nonmobile or has significant impairment of mobility that will limit compliance with postop exercise
